episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and intriguing facts, including historical police practices, unexpected scientific discoveries, celebrity trivia, and unusual uses of scratch and sniff technology.

facts.fact: Before we had the technology to take photos for mug shots, policemen had to visit prisons to memorize all the inmates' appearances.
Scientists working in the Arctic Ocean have caught Chlamydia and they can't explain how.
Jessica Alba has ridden the London Eye 31 times.
In 2003, the County of Ottawa, Michigan released a brochure for would-be residents to prepare them for living in the countryside. It included a scratch and sniff that emitted the smell of manure.
